result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from ADA Motsch regarding trial documents

Defendant Anthony Brooks in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - G.
BTC: GUILTY.
$100+cc+DNA, pp $25/mo beg 1-15-16, ftp 3 days RCJ for contempt.

Defendant Anthony Brooks in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled for Jury trial on 12-17-15.
Def is requesting another status date the week before trial.
State needs to meet with the victims.
BTC: Matter adjourned, new status date set.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Brooks in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Defense requests JT date. 
BTC: JT and STC dates set  Jury trial scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Brooks in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Christopher D. Steenrod for Erika Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Charlotte Lacey.
Deft is involved in a treatment program.
Def has not been appointed on the BJ charge.
Def is requesting an adjournment.
Deft indicates that he did go back to the SPD's office.
State does not object to an adjournment.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim, SB (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with 512 16th Street. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Anthony Brooks in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Brooks in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State does not have a copy of the complaint.
Def is requesting an adjournment.
Def indicates he has not been appointed yet on this case.
Deft is going to go to the SPD's office after court in regards to this new case.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
